definition: to capture/to restrain/to constrain/to adhere rigidly to/inflexible
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: Try to discourage such familiarities from your subordinates.
sentences.chinese: 不要让下属对你这样不拘礼节。

sentences.english: There is no need for ceremony between friends.
We don't stand on ceremony in this house.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这房子里不必拘礼。

sentences.english: They were received without ceremony, ie informally.
sentences.chinese: 他们受到不拘礼节的欢迎。

sentences.english: Be " guy " an informal sort of word?
sentences.chinese: 是一种随便不拘礼节的词吗？

sentences.english: It's wonderful to let your hair down at the weekend after you've been working hard all week.
sentences.chinese: 辛苦工作一周后在周末不拘礼节轻松一下真是太好了。

sentences.english: Here informal goings and comings are not allowed.
sentences.chinese: 在这里，不允许有不拘礼节的来往。

sentences.english: Is"guy" an informal sort of word?
sentences.chinese: 是一种随便不拘礼节的词吗？

sentences.english: There was no ceremony about dining.
sentences.chinese: 在这里吃饭可以不拘礼节。

sentences.english: Her attentions to the guests were too ceremonious .
sentences.chinese: 她对客人的款待过于拘礼了。

sentences.english: There's no need for ceremony between friends.

definition: to regard sb as an outsider
(old) to stand up (after kowtowing)/You may rise.
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to mind/to brood over/to be concerned about
you're welcome/don't mention it/no need to stand on ceremony
to be a stickler for formalities/to rigidly adhere to/to cling to/constrained/ill at ease
to not deserve (one's good fortune etc)
